description: A game is a release-agnostic pinball table.
title: Game

___model_number.description: The model number of this game given by the manufacturer.

___year.description: The year in which the games was released.

___artists.description: A list of people who provided artwork for the game.

___created_at.description: Timestamp when the game was added to the database.

___manufacturer.description: Name of the game manufacturer. For *original games*, put the author name or alias.

___toys.description: Toys that are on the playfield of the game.

___title.description: The full title of the game.

___themes.description: A list of themes related to the game.

___slogans.description: Slogans used when advertising the game.

___game_type.description:
How the game is built. The following are valid values:
 * `ss` - Solid state game
 * `em` - Electro-mechanical game
 * `pm` - Pure mechanical game
 * `og` - Original game
 * `na` - Not available (unknown)

___produced_units.description: How my units of this game were manufactured.

___description.description: A short description of the game. Will be Markdown formatted.

___backglass.description: Reference to an uploaded backglass image.

____created_by.description: Reference to the user who created this game. Only visible by contributors and above.

___instructions.description: Instructions how to play the game. Will be Markdown formatted.

___short.description: A list of common abbreviations for the game.

___notes.description: Any special notes about the game.

___rating.description: Rating at the time the games was added to the database.

___id.description: Unique identifier for a game. Must be set at creation and becomes read-only after that. Typically the most common abbreviation of a game is used, e.g. `afm` for *Attack From Mars*.

___designers.description: A list of people who designed the gameplay.
